chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Barrett A. Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Barrett A. Rogers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Barrett A. Rogers was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Barrett A. Rogers was found guilty of Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Ct.1 - Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Ct.3 - Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge (Ct.3 only).
May not have contact with Janette Trejo, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments are made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years in Count 1 and 3 years in Count 3 with conditions.  Each Count is concurrent, but consecutive to any other sentence.  In Count 1 court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs and in Count 3 only costs & DNA surcharge.  No contact with Janetta T. unless permitted by the court only.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Barrett A. Rogers, appeared in custody with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Clerk: PT
Atty Parise requests sentencing be moved to later this week to allow him time to go over PSI with DE as he is here on a writ; no objection by the State.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
